July 31, 1957
Dr. Burton Paulu
K U 0 K, One Eddy Hall
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis, Minnesota
Dear Burton:
1*111 writing lots of people so they’ll have something
to read on top of their desks when they get back from
vacation. Also, serves added purposes of helping clear
top of mine now.
I've been meaning to write this for a long time.
I'm greatly concerned about decision to change name of the
Advisory Committee to the President of the ETRC. I’m not
even sure it’s legal to do so. But more important to me
is the backward step. The Committee was set up with a
purpose, and to me that purpose still exists. In Ann Arbor
you said we couldn't hope to advise the President of the
Center. With this I also must disagree. We have done so,
and we can continue to do so. And it was intended so by
the people who gave the money.
I don't think liason and advisory have the same
meanings.
While I feel strongly, this letter is not written with
belligerence. It’s written because of strong convention,
however.
Trust you h ve a pleasant vacation.
Sincerely,
Frank E. Schooley
